Comment: The Duras Gambit or Fred Defence.
This opening move is only good in Kriegspiel.
Opening a line to win back the gambited Pawn.
Forcing a further weakening of Black's already shattered position.
The equally bad alternative was 4... K-B3.
If now 5... PxP, Pillsbury wins a piece with 6 QxR.
Trying to block off the Pawn and find shelter for his King.
Threatening to win at least a piece with 7 PxP.
Trying to drive off the powerfully posted Queen, as well as guard the threatened KRP.
Adding another piece to the rapidly mounting attack.
Opening up the space around the King to allow the Q to penetrate.
8... RxP was the other choice, which would have created a flight square at KR1 for the King and perhaps dragged out the resistance.
